author: Unreal Engine
description:
Discover how to combine scanned materials with your own Substrate assets to build high-fidelity, reality-based environments. This session recorded at Unreal Fest Stockholm
guides you through separating key components like materials, lighting, cameras, and post-processing for better control and realism.

You'll learn about upcoming AxF material support, enhanced Substrate and Interchange workflows, and how to create complementary Substrate materials to match captured assets. 

The session covers techniques for lighting and camera setup in portal-to-reality projects, including how to match real-world lighting using classification strategies and a custom light meter tool built in Unreal Engine.

Learn more about Unreal Engine here: unrealengine.com

#Materials, #Substrate, #AxF, #UnrealEngine, #UE5, #UnrealFestStockholm
title: Portal to Reality: Fusing Real-World Assets with Unreal Workflows | Unreal Fest Stockholm 2025

author: Unreal Engine
description:
We've got some of the folks behind the Game Animation Sample Project coming on this week to chat all about the latest updates to the project (like the addition of the Mover plugin!) and answer questions you may have about the tools and what's latest. 

Check out the sample here: https://www.fab.com/listings/880e319a-a59e-4ed2-b268-b32dac7fa016
title: GASP - It's Mover! Game Animation Sample Updates + Q&A | Inside Unreal

author: Unreal Engine
description:
In this technical deep dive recorded at Unreal Fest Stockholm, Brent Schiestl and Johan Karlsson equip administrators and team leaders with proven techniques for optimizing Perforce P4 workflows in Unreal Engine environments, drawing from their extensive experience working with the leading organizations across the gaming, media and entertainment, and automotive industries. 

Brent's talk walks you through several P4 server topologies and branching strategies and why they work, and Johan showcases how studios leverage pre- and post-commit models in P4 Code Review to accelerate quality control processes and strengthen development standards. 

Whether you manage a small indie team or a large production pipeline, you'll come away with practical strategies to enhance collaboration and build a stronger development infrastructure that scales with your studio's growth.

Learn more about Unreal Engine here: unrealengine.com

#Perforce, #P4, #P4CodeReview, #UnrealEngine, #UE5, #UnrealFestStockh
title: Perforce Workflows That Scale from Small to Large Teams | Unreal Fest Stockholm 2025

author: Unreal Engine
description:
This session recorded at Unreal Fest Stockholm highlights the latest features in groom deformation tools in Unreal Engine, which have been recently updated for greater customization and interactions between elements.

Learn how to set up a custom groom deformation pipeline using the newly introduced dataflow construction graph, and add attributes, paint them, and reuse them with a deformer graph.

The demonstration also shows how to rebuild groom asset guides from strands geometry non-destructively with dataflow nodes, showing how to write a custom deformer and see the results in the dataflow editor for efficient debugging. The session also covers interactions between different components and groups via the groom solver component.

All these new features make the groom system much more flexible, and give technical artists much more freedom in how they build their deformation pipelines.

Learn more about Unreal Engine here: unrealengine.com

#Grooms, #GroomDeformation, #DataflowConstru
title: Advanced Groom Dataflow Setup in UE 5.7 | Unreal Fest Stockholm 2025

author: Unreal Engine
description: Join us next week right here on the Unreal Engine YouTube channel as we peek behind the curtain on the recreation of Quentin Tarantino’s lost Kill Bill chapter in Fortnite.
title: Tarantino’s lost Kill Bill chapter is lost no more🟨
